Description: A flat finger-ring: composed of a hoop of mother-of-pearl. Upper and lower rims have been flattened; the depth of the ring is not uniform throughout.
Curator's comments: The date assigned to this ring is very uncertain. Simple rings of bone and ivory, some of which may have been finger-rings, have been found in Late Predynastic graves, see W. M. F. Petrie, ‘Prehistoric Egypt’ (London, 1920), 31; pl.XXXI; E. Baumgartel, Cultures of Prehistoric Egypt' II (Oxford, 1960), 76-7; G. Möller & A. Scharff, ‘Die archaeologischen Ergebnisse des Vorgeschichtlichen Gräberfeldes von Abusir el-Meleq’ (Osnabrück, 1969), 56; pl.35, no. 367; G. A. Reisner, ‘Archaeological Survey of Nubia, 1907-8’ (Cairo, 1910), pl.66b, nos. 8-11; H. Junker, ‘Bericht über die Grabungen der Akademie der Wissenschaften in Wein auf den Friedhöfen von el-Kubanieh-Süd. Winter 1910-11’ (Vienna, 1919), 97; pl.XXXVb.
Bibliographic references: Andrews 1981 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities. Jewellery I (137)
